sentence.text: Single marker-based association tests for corneal astigmatism identified four genome-wide significant loci (P < 5 × 10<sup>-8</sup>) near the genes ZC3H11B (1q41), LINC00340 (6p22.3), HERC2/OCA2 (15q13.1) and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process/TSPAN10 (17q25.3).

Three of these loci also demonstrated genome-wide significant association with refractive astigmatism: LINC00340, cellular response to DNA damage stimulus/OCA2 and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process/TSPAN10.

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus

sentence.text: These loci have previously demonstrated association with axial length (ZC3H11B), myopia (NPLOC4), spherical equivalent refractive error (LINC00340) and eye colour (cellular response to DNA damage stimulus).

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
